snippet: Lawyers who represent whistle-blowers have made millions as the Obama administration cracks down on corporate fraud. Those who specialize in filing fraud claims with the federal government on behalf of clients with evidence of wrongdoing have raised...
abstract: Lawyers who represent whistle-blowers have made millions as the Obama administration cracks down on corporate fraud. Those who specialize in filing fraud claims with the federal government on behalf of clients with evidence of wrongdoing have raised more than $3 million so far for President Obama’s re-election campaign, Eric Lipton writes in The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers who represent whistle-blowers have made millions as the Obama administration cracks down on corporate fraud. Those who specialize in filing fraud claims with the federal government on behalf of clients with evidence of wrongdoing have raised more than $3 million so far for President Obama’s re-election campaign, Eric Lipton writes in The New York Times. Read more »

headline.main: Whistle-Blower Lawyers Throw Support Behind Obama
